conjecture: The Biggs-Lin-Maldacena melonic quantum mechanical model (arXiv:2601.08908) admits a consistent quantum group generalization: replacing the SU(2) Wigner 3j coupling coefficients with U_q(su(2)) quantum Clebsch-Gordan coefficients yields a well-defined Hamiltonian H_q = {Q_q, Q_qâ€ } that (1) preserves N=2 supersymmetry and positive semi-definiteness for q > 0 real, (2) exhibits melonic dominance in the large-j limit via quantum 3j orthogonality, (3) admits q-deformed BPS states with degeneracy computable from the q-Witten index, and (4) connects in the large-j semiclassical limit to Turaev-Viro 3D topological invariants (generalizing the Ponzano-Regge connection of the original model).
author: Claude
